question: What is the SPRTN protein function?
ideal_answer: The protease SPRTN emerged as the essential enzyme for DNA-protein crosslink proteolysis repair.

snippets.text: we explored the role of Spartan (SPRTN), a metalloprotease associated with DNA replication, which removes proteins forming DPCs.
Repair of covalent DNA-protein crosslinks (DPCs) by the metalloprotease SPRTN prevents genome instability, premature aging and carcinogenesis.
The protease SPRTN emerged as the essential enzyme for DNA-protein crosslink proteolysis repair
Covalent DNA-protein crosslinks (DPCs) have emerged as pervasive sources of genome instability. DPCs are targeted for repair by DNA-dependent proteases of the Wss1/SPRTN family.
